projects.title: Translational Research
projects.description: Under Dr. Ronald Falk at the UNC Kidney Center, I conducted bench research on immune-mediated kidney diseases, with a strong focus on T cell biology. My investigations into the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine's efficacy in immunosuppressed patients bridged the lab and the clinic, directly impacting patient care. This experience has transformed my commitment to medicine, desiring not only to be a practitioner of medicine as a physician but a contributor to medicine as a scientist.

Efficacy of SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Immuno: Processed blood samples and isolated PBMCs for immunological testing
Performed ELISpot assays and flow cytometry
Conducted advanced data analysis using statistical and machine learning methods
Authored and defended my undergraduate honors thesis on this project
Identifying and Characterizing CD8+ Treg: Conducted a literature review and feasibility assessment
Proposed an experimental design and budget
CD4+ Treg Functionality Assays: Isolated Tregs in a GCP-compliant facility
Managed and maintained Treg cell cultures
Murine Model Experiments: Extracted splenocytes from whole mouse spleens
Reconstituted suspensions for reintroduction into mouse models

projects.title: Science Communication and Education
projects.description: Early in college, I saw how unnecessarily convoluted science communication was often made and, as public trust in science declined during the pandemic, I was driven to make scientific knowledge more accessible. This conviction led me to pursue both science writing and teaching as powerful tools to make knowledge accessible, engaging, and impactful.

Science Writing Portfolio: Published articles on immunology, infectious disease, and cancer research
Specialized in translating complex scientific concepts for general audiences
Covered breakthrough research in accessible, engaging formats
Maintained scientific accuracy while ensuring readability
Educational Impact: Taught undergraduate courses in biology and chemistry
Developed innovative teaching methods for complex scientific concepts
Mentored students in research methodology and scientific writing
Created educational content for diverse learning styles

projects.title: Direct Patient Care
projects.description: Patients are the reason I chose to pursue medicine, and my role on 6 Children's gave me my first experience with direct responsibility for their care. As a combined Nursing Assistant and Healthcare Unit Clerk in a 24-bed intermediate unit, I supported children on Neurology, Pulmonary, GI, Endocrine, and General Pediatric services. Balancing clinical duties with administrative coordination and care team communication with patient and family support, I learned to be both a caregiver and a team communicator strengthening my commitment to patient-centered medicine.

Clinical Responsibilities: Provided direct patient care including vital signs, mobility assistance, and comfort measures
Documented patient conditions and responses in electronic health records
Coordinated with multidisciplinary teams including physicians, nurses, and therapists
Administrative Duties: Managed patient admissions, discharges, and transfers
Coordinated scheduling for procedures and appointments
Maintained accurate medical records and documentation
Facilitated communication between care teams and families

projects.title: Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI
projects.description: My interest in AI/ML was sparked during the generative AI boom of late 2022, when OpenAI rolled out GPT-3.5 to the public in the form of ChatGPT, reshaping how we think about knowledge and automation. Soon after, I immersed myself in the field and, as an intern at Syneos Health, built the prototype of an AI-augmented clinical trial protocol generator. The project gained recognition for its innovation, ultimately being featured in Wired.

AI Protocol Generator: Developed prototype using advanced NLP and machine learning techniques
Integrated multiple data sources to generate comprehensive clinical trial protocols
Implemented retrieval-augmented generation for improved accuracy
Achieved significant time savings in protocol development process
Technical Implementation: Built on Azure cloud infrastructure for scalability
Utilized OpenAI GPT models with custom fine-tuning
Implemented vector databases for efficient information retrieval
Created user-friendly interfaces for non-technical stakeholders

projects.title: Application Development
projects.description: I built my first app as a junior in high school for a computer science elective in Swift modeling the "pong" game on GamePigeon. Eight years later, I have developed well over a dozen applications in half-a-dozen different languages. From an iOS expiration date tracker to an automated secret Santa algorithm, the freedom of imagination and the zero-cost to produce has made programming not just a hobby but a means of personal creation.

Mobile Applications: iOS expiration date tracker with push notifications
Web Applications: Full-stack web applications with modern frameworks

projects.title: Public Health, Healthcare Accessibility, and Health Equity
projects.description: Wednesday nights from 6PM until 12AM, I would assist individuals in my community receive health insurance and health coverage at a clinic down the road from my university. Beyond clinic hours, I often fielded calls from patients throughout the week, guiding them in transitioning to long-term, stable care solutions. This role sat at the intersection of the social and medical, revealing to me the complexities of the US healthcare system and empowering me to leverage my understanding to assist others.

Insurance Navigation: Assisted with Health Insurance Marketplace applications
Guided patients through Medicaid and Medicare enrollment
Helped coordinate transitions between different coverage types
Provided bilingual support for Spanish-speaking patients
Care Coordination: Connected patients with appropriate healthcare providers
Assisted with prescription drug assistance programs
Coordinated dental and vision care coverage
Provided follow-up support for ongoing healthcare needs

projects.title: Community Service
projects.description: My father is an Eagle Scout meaning I grew up with the Sir Robert Baden-Powell quote "try to leave this world a little better than you found it." While many of my father's sayings made me laugh (or roll my eyes), this one has shaped how I live my life. For more than a decade, I've committed myself to volunteering in different capacities, making service not just an activity but a core part of how I spend my free time and contribute to my community.

Leadership Roles: Led volunteer teams for community service projects
Organized fundraising events for local nonprofits
Mentored youth in educational and personal development
Coordinated outreach programs for underserved populations

projects.title: Entrepreneurship
projects.description: I helped my father build and launch Six Components, a consulting firm that enables healthcare solution companies to leverage big data, implement AI, and become digital-first enterprises. I developed the brand identity, designed the website, and co-created our client outreach strategy. With no roadmap and a constantly evolving set of challenges, I learned by doing â€” adapting quickly, solving problems creatively, and thinking strategically. This hands-on experience in fast-paced, solution-driven work inspired me to pursue my own entrepreneurial ventures, which I am now developing to transform how medicine meets a changing world.

Business Development: Co-founded and developed Six Components from concept to execution
Created comprehensive brand identity and marketing strategy
Developed client acquisition and retention strategies
Managed business operations and project delivery
Technical Implementation: Built company website with modern design and functionality
Implemented custom AI solutions for healthcare clients
Developed automated workflows for business processes
Created content management and client communication systems
